title: About
text: I love R and Rstudio for many reasons, the number one being the community. I hope this blog can be a positive contribution to the R community from which I’ve gained so much. Enjoy!

title: Welcome To My Blog
text: Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Post With Amazing Code
text: This is a post with executable code.

title: Post With Amazing Code
text:
Check Out This Plot!

penguins %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +
  geom_point()

title: DRAFT Post With Amazing Code
text:
The website name will come directly from the github repo name
cp -r myblog/* .
git config –global user.email “simon.heitin@gmail.com” git config –global user.name “Simon Heitin”
Seems like this page says that there are 3 different ways to publish to GitHub Pages and that each one is “the simplest” https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/github-pages.html
Adding a new post https://quarto.org/docs/websites/website-blog.html#posts-directory
I’ll use the first workflow - publish from the docs directory
